Reviews.Title: good little camera
Reviews.Author: R. Ritzman "sfseals"
Reviews.Content: In bright daylight the FE-130 takes bright crisp pictures with vivid colors.  At night, the flash provides plenty of light at medium to close range.  The "night mode" (which keepts the shutter open for several seconds while snapping a quick flash) is a neat feature that I've enjoyed using as well.While not the smallest of the subcompacts, it is surprisingly small and light, and comfortably fits in a jacket or even shirt pocket.There is no memory included, so you'll need to buy an XD card, preferably 512 mb or more.The camera runs on 2 AA's which is convenient, and I've been getting around 50 or 60 shots in (with heavy use of the flash) between replacements, which is not bad for a couple of measly AA's.The included Olympus Master software is intuitive and easy to use.The display is smallish (2 inch), which is a bit of a nuisance if you are used to a larger one but is clear and bright.Overall, I'm happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for new and experienced users!
Reviews.Content: I got my first digital camera a couple years ago, and as I learned more about digital cameras I started to search for a new one. Then I stumbled on the Olympus FE-130. I just bought it recently, and it lived up to all my expectations! It has many unique shooting modes so you can achieve the right setting, has an excellent display screen, and takes quality pictures (5.1 MP is great!) The only problem is that it doesn't have a view finder, and it doesn't have a black and white color setting mode (at least, I haven't found it yet!) Overall, this camera is worth the money and I highly recommend it to any photography lover.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: L. Nix
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with my new camera.  It's compact with a large viewing screen and an amazing helpful guide.  Very user friendly.  The video functionality is crisp and clear as well the pictures.  I bought this one for work and may buy another for me at home.  I highly recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: Broken Latch -- Lousy Service
Reviews.Author: Joe Banks
Reviews.Content: We had this camera for a few weeks, it took mediocre pictures.  Then the flimsey plastic latch to the battery compartment broke.  This is an amazingly cheap flaw for a (supposedly) good brand.  Anyway, we mailed it in to be fixed to an Olympus repair center in NY and are still waiting to get it back (3 weeks later).  At this point I'm not sure I care if I get it back or not.  I'm already looking at other cameras.  Update:  I got a letter from Olympus informing me that the problem is not under warranty and it will cost $100.70 to fix what is probably a $0.10 plastic latch. No thank you.  Guess whose products I am never going to buy again?  I am also going to plaster this review on any consumer website I can find.  Smart move Olympus!

Reviews.Title: pocket size with big quality
Reviews.Author: S. Wallace "Avonlea Watcher"
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with my little handy camera. It takes nice pictures and is easy to use. It's also easy to transfer the images to a computer or printer. I gave it 3 stars for the following, it's slow to capture an image, there's like a 1 second delay which makes taking pictures of children and animals pretty tedious if they are moving around.Also you can capture movies but they don't have sound.Other wise a great pocket size camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Sanders
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera a few weeks ago, and it's absolutely great. There wasn't anything broken. The latch that covers the batteries and SD card has a little lock to hold it in place. The pros outweight the cons. The only thing bad about this camera, is that if you are in a room that does not have a lot of light the pictures may be a little dim, depending on the settings you have on the camera. Other than that, there are a lot of features. It does have the black and white,sepia, frames, and pre-text features to use after you snap a photo. It doesn't use the battery power quick like most battery operated cameras have. As far as getting the pictures developed, I'm not sure if there are any pixelations that show, but using them for email, website, etc., the pictures are clear and Crisp.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ginny
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for a few weeks, but so far I love it.  It's very easy to use and has lots of different options to improve my pictures.  The movie option is especially fun.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Huck Finn "moeron5"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. The red eye fix option is a lifesaver. I still can't get used to the delay but I suppose digital will always be this way.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Chrissy
Reviews.Content: Hi, I got this camera & really love it. One problem though, when I got a memory card, I saw the writing that says 'push to eject' & what looked like a button. Well I pressed it really hard & broke something off & got the 'card cover open' message. I then realized that you are supposed to push the memory card itself, not this other thing.I took to a camera shop I found online. The guy told me it would be expensive to really fix it but that he could 'rig it up' & be just as good. I was shocked when he did it for nothing.Anyways, I am happy with this camera just wish I had read the manual about the memory card as I have never used one before. I have the FE-140 but it i almost identical to this & mine is 6 megapixels, not 5.

Reviews.Title: olympus
Reviews.Author: Evripidou Maria
Reviews.Content: nice camera it does its job, btut I am dissapointed because it doenst ahve sound in its videos, unlike what I saw online. Except if Im doing something wrong

Reviews.Title: Same latch trouble!!
Reviews.Author: C. M. Thompson
Reviews.Content: I agree with several of the people who have written in here. I have used the camera for a grand total of maybe 2 weeks and it is hitting me with the "Card cover open" message mentioned in other reviews and it will not do anything else. The small button one needs to push to eject the memory card broke the first time I ejected the card, and as you have read from other reviews here, they will fix it, but for about $100. On to a better camera. Olympus has lost my business as well! AVOID THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!!
Reviews.Author: S. Henley
Reviews.Content: The battery cover lock broke and now it won't take pictures.  I contacted Olympus to order just the cover so I can repair it, and the repair dept. has the parts but they wont sell the parts to consumers.  But for about $100, I can send them the camera and they can repair it for me.  It costs a little over $100 for the camera I and refuse to pay the same for the repair of the lock.  Olympus was apologetic, but not going to be helpful.  I am stuck with a non functional camera due to just a broken lock.BEWARE!!

Reviews.Title: Fatal latch flaw
Reviews.Author: Gavin Helf
Reviews.Content: I too had the battery cover fail when switching batteries, and ther is no reasonable way to fix the problem.  a big waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Bad Design
Reviews.Author: C. Brock
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and it was only used for 3 weeks before some sensor malfunctioned and now the camera won't take pictures or do anything else becaused it says "Card-Cover Open" even thought the card cover is firmly closed and latched.  You have to open the card cover to remove the memory card or replace the batteries and since it appears that it is so easily broken, I believe this is a very poor design!  Do not buy this camera unless you want to buy another one within a few weeks of use.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Content: I got this camera in November and have enjoyed using it very much! It is great for anyone who wants a great little camera for taking fun pictures with friends or family. I would recommend this to people my age (13)and even to adults.There are just a fefw drawbacks, including an extended shutter delay when you are using specific modes, and the battery doesn't last very long before you have to replace them.Overall though, the good quaities (including the fact that it can hold up to about 270 pictures withot even buying an additional memory card)override the bad ones!

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed with the Olmpus brand
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Morgan
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this camera for the arrival of our first born and as such we were "very excited" about capturing all those wonderful first moments.However what we are experiencing instead is a camera packed with producing poor images.  We thought that we were probably using the camera incorrectly bu t when I got my friend's Kodac I realized that it was not the way we were taking the pictures.The Purchase order number for the camera is #102-2892527-1289725

Reviews.Title: everything good
Reviews.Author: A. Hefty "saabdvr"
Reviews.Content: As always my purchase with amazon was excellent.  Easy to access, the product was perfectly explained and the service easy and fast.  Good Job!

ProductInfo.Features:
5.1-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 13 x 17-inch prints
2.0-inch LCD; 3x optical zoom
Built-in Help Guide for easy operation; in-camera editing features such as Red-Eye Fix and adding frames
Digital Image Stabilization Mode for capturing crisp, clear pictures
Powered by 2 AA-size batteries; stores images on xD Picture Cards
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus FE-130 5.1MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom
